meanings.definition: A type of Polish pastry, typically filled with fruit or cream.
meanings.sent1: I bought some delicious paczkis from the bakery.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, everyone enjoyed the sweet paczkis.
meanings.sent3: The paczkis at the party disappeared in no time!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a paczkis.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked paczkis filled the room.

meanings.definition: The plural form of paczki, a traditional Polish dessert.
meanings.sent1: She brought a box of paczkis to share with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The paczkis were a hit at the family gathering.
meanings.sent3: The kids were excited to have paczkis for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the scent of warm paczkis.
meanings.sent5: The paczkis were like little pockets of happiness.

meanings.definition: To eat or enjoy paczkis during the celebration of Fat Tuesday.
meanings.sent1: Let's all gather and paczkis together on Fat Tuesday!
meanings.sent2: They always paczkis with their friends on this special day.
meanings.sent3: I can't wait to paczkis with you at the party!
meanings.sent4: She decided to paczkis with enthusiasm at the event.
meanings.sent5: The whole town came together to paczkis and celebrate.
